alert.note: Alert for Ballard; Livingston; Marshall; McCracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski, Massac, central Pope, southern Johnson, Livingston, northwestern Marshall, northeastern Ballard and McCracken Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Columbia to near West Paducah to Lovelaceville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dixon Springs around 310 PM CDT. Paducah, Lone Oak and Brookport around 315 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Golconda, Reidland, Ledbetter, Joy, Burna, Calvert City and Salem. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 19. Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 15 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
